ygData.subject: Re: Marriage
ygData.msgSnippet: Greetings everyone!  Well it seems I may have spoken just a bit too soon, lol! Yesterday I wrote that I expected to have to face the honeymoon roleplay
ygData.messageBody:
Greetings everyone!

<ooc>
Well it seems I may have spoken just a bit too soon, lol!
Yesterday I wrote that I expected to have to face the
honeymoon roleplay eventually. Well, it seems eventually
is coming sooner than I thought! <g> Ok, ok, I'll spit
it out. :-)

<ic>
Last night Rezok proposed to me ... and I accepted!! :-)
Isn't it thrilling?! <claps her hands in excitement>
We've not set a date or ironed out any plans yet. I
think I was just too excited being *betrothed* to think
clearly on all the details. And oh! there's so many
details. <mind races>

It was sooooo romantic. He secretly planned to have two
of our closest friends there to witness. And then he
recited a beautiful poem to me ... the last line of which
was "Will you marry me, we'd make quite a pair". I sat
stunned for a moment, then blurted out "Really?" (what a
fool I felt later). It took me some doing to find my
voice and answer "YES" ... poor fellow had to sit there
and wait while I got my brain to working again. <s>

Anyways, I could ramble on and on ... so I'll spare you
all. :-) Once we have the wedding details ironed out, I
shall let you all know ... for of course, you're all
invited. <s>

Safe travels,
Wynsong

P.S. - Dnaice, I shall try very hard to attend your
wedding. :-)

--
~~~ Remember that our illusion of control is just
that ... an illusion ~~~

weya@...
weya@...
ICQ#1976509

>____________________________________________________________________________
___
>____________________________________________________________________________
___
>
>Message: 9
> Date: Thu, 05 Aug 1999 11:41:54 -0700
> From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
>Subject: Re: Marriage
>
>It is so interesting to read one another's experiences. We are starting
to talk a bit more
>about RL, he has a Golden Retriever, lives in VA, etc. He knows
I am a CS and AI is my hobby
>(I explained I had learned why he runs around in circles and then
disappers and his brain
>went into overdrive *smile*). I suspect he may be a student as he
doesn't have "regular"
>work hours, but then I'm "on the beach" at work since the recent
take-over obsoleted my
>technology so one never really knows *smile*. I did make my first
reference to "our" when
>discussing missing my dog (OES, she died 2 mos. ago) and he didn't
cringe outwardly. Didn't
>comment either so it could have gone right over his head.
>
>Okay, I'm neurotic. I'm afraid if he finds out I'm a married mother
of 2 he might lose
>interest and he is the most fun part of the game. *sigh* This is
worse then RL. Oh, and as
>for the toilets, I noticed their lack when I got drunk and needed
to throw up. There was no
>place to puke! Very embarassing. And as my aclohol level is 3,
the wedding party itself may
>be a disaster.
>
>The honeymoon will definitely be PG. I sort of view this is my equivalent
to the romance
>novel *grin*.
>
>Dnaice on Quellious
>Trisango on Brel Serillis
>Troxfo on Vallon Zek
>
>P.S. The wedding is Sunday, Aug. 7 at the Temple of Marr (outside)
in N. Freeport on the
>Quellious Server. 5 PM Pacific, 6 PM Mountain, 7 PM Central, and
8 PM Eastern.
>
>P.P.S. When we roleplay we do it in talk rather than say - but our
/ems have been known to
>produce a lot of puking and "Get a room" comments from those around
us *smile*
>
>weya@... wrote:
>
>> From: weya@...
>>
>> Dnaice,
>>
>> You bring up a bridge that I know I will have to cross eventually
as well. My character,
>> Wynsong, is very serious about a high elf named Rezok on Fenin
Ro. OOC, I know very
>> little about the person behind the character save that he's male,
a few years younger
>> than me, and married (his r/l wife plays a character that is like
a big sister to
>> Wynsong). Because I'm very happily married in r/l, very soon into
the rp "relationship"
>> I set some expectations that the relationship was rp-only ... which
his response was "of
>> course" (what a relief that was). I felt stupid bringing it up
at all, but after some
>> experiences in Realm where ppl wanted the char's relationship to
spill over to the
>> players, I learned to speak up front to avoid sticky situations
later.
>>
>> As for the honeymoon ... you can rp that any way you wish. It
depends upon what "rating"
>> <g> you want that portion of the rp to be. It can simply be the
two of you "retire" to
>> the honeymoon suite and then chat about the weather while everyone
accepts that it's the
>> wedding night. You could decide to go on a trip to a "romantic"
spot in Norrath and
>> hunt, explore, etc. Or if you wish, you could take the roleplay
further .... To me,
>> the roleplaying is about how the character(s) is perceived in Norrath.
So that doesn't
>> mean I have to roleplay every single detail. Heck, we don't roleplay
going to the
>> bathroom or showering or any of the hundreds of mundane (or not
so mundane) personal
>> things we do irl. Personally, my honeymoon will probably be rated
pg to pg-13 <g> ...
>> Disney would prolly be able to put it in one of their movies, lol.
But the concept of
>> honeymoon will be there
>> for everyone (us, friends, "family") ... and that's the important
part.
>>
>> As a side note ... I did have a marriage on Realm and while the
characters were
>> roleplaying their "true love" for the world ... the other player
and I would be /t'ing
>> each other chatting about all kinds of <ic> and <ooc> stuff. When
it came time for the
>> honeymoon, we retired to the bedroom while our friends partied
in the next room ... and
>> just joked around and chatted some more. For the role play, we
had gone to the marriage
>> bed ... for us, the players, we had not crossed any lines that
would complicate our
>> personal r/l relationships.
>>
>> Ok, well I've rambled enough. Thanks for putting up with it as
I thought through my own
>> eventual situation.
>>
>> Hey, btw ... I lost the date, time and place (and server) for your
wedding. :-)
>>
>> Safe travels,
>> Wynsong
>> Woodelf Bard -- Fenin Ro
>> Soerbaird Academy
>>
>> > ________________________________________________________________________
______
>> > ________________________________________________________________________
_______
>> >
>> > Message: 6
>> > Date: Tue, 03 Aug 1999 16:43:16 -0700
>> > From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
>> > Subject: Marriage
>> >
>> > As my character is marrying on Sunday I must confess to a few
minor qualms. In
>> > particular, er, how does one roleplay a honeymoon *smile*. Unlike
many who
>> > develop relationships in Norrath, my beloved and I are unknown
to one another in
>> > RL. For all I know he weighs 300 pounds, guzzles beer, and is
hygenically
>> > challenged *smile*
>> >
>> > There are times if I wonder if this is a positive thing to be
doing. I mean,
>> > what if he is some starry eyed adolescent and I ruin him for
life *grin*. I know
>> > MY lines are clearly drawn in fuzz (okay, I think I know the
difference between
>> > reality and fantasy though I swear I saw a Pixie Trickster in
the airport the
>> > other day *grin*).
>> >
>> > Anyway, this is all fun and games and I am having fun. But there
is this part in
>> > the back of my mind that wonders. Because unlike reading romance
novels (blech -
>> > persish the thought) there is another person involved in my little
fantasy and I
>> > must never forget that.
>> >
>> > Any other hard core role players out there struggle with these
ridiculous
>> > issues? Any other players over the age of 25, for that matter
*smile*
>> >
>> > Dnaice on Quellious
>> > Trisango on Brell Serilis
>> >
